title: How to Clean White Canvas Shoes

steps.title: Let any mud or dirt dry before cleaning your shoes.
steps.content: Let any mud or dirt dry before cleaning your shoes. Once dry, tap the soles together to clear the treads. Use an old toothbrush to scrape off the larger pieces of dirt and get into the shoe's creases.

steps.title: Take out your shoe laces.
steps.content: Take out your shoe laces. Place the laces in a container with water and a few drops of detergent to let them soak. [2] X Research source You could also just buy new laces and save yourself the effort. Put aside the old pair for craft projects or simply get rid of them. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Clean the soles.
steps.content: Clean the soles. Make a solution of equal parts water and baking soda in a small bowl. Dip the toothbrush in and gently massage the paste into the soles. Then, wipe the soles clean. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Make a detergent solution.
steps.content: Make a detergent solution. Add a few drops of regular laundry detergent in a basin with cold water. Mix the solution together.

steps.title: Dip the toothbrush into the solution.
steps.content: Dip the toothbrush into the solution. Begin to clean your shoe using circular motions from the outside of the stain inwards. An old electric toothbrush can be a great alternative to a regular toothbrush, since it requires minimal effort from you! Rinse and repeat until the canvas is clean. Once you are satisfied with the cleanliness of the shoe, rinse it well with more cold water to remove any traces of soap. You'll want to do this carefully because dried soap residue can leave their own stains on your shoes. Then do the other shoe. When rinsing, try your best to not get any water inside of the shoe.

steps.title: Let your shoes dry.
steps.content: Let your shoes dry. Place the shoes in a well ventilated area and let them air dry. Placing them outside on a warm day in the sun is a great idea. [5] X Research source To help the shoes keep their structure as they dry, ball up a rag or paper towel and stuff them inside the shoes. [6] X Research source Make sure they are fully dry before you wear them.

steps.title: Scrub the shoelaces and then rinse them.
steps.content: Scrub the shoelaces and then rinse them. Let shoelaces hang to dry. Once your shoes and laces are washed, wait for them to fully dry. Then enjoy your almost-new looking shoes!

steps.title: Let any mud or dirt dry before cleaning your shoes.
steps.content: Let any mud or dirt dry before cleaning your shoes. Once dry, tap the soles together to clear the treads. Use an old toothbrush to scrape off the larger pieces of dirt and debris. [7] X Research source This prep work will make for easier stain removal and washing.

steps.title: Clean the soles.
steps.content: Clean the soles. Make a solution of equal parts water and baking soda in a small bowl. Dip the toothbrush in and gently massage the paste into the soles Then, wipe the soles clean. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Bring your shoes to your washing machine.
steps.content: Bring your shoes to your washing machine. Run a gentle cycle with cold water. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Add a gentle detergent.
steps.content: Add a gentle detergent. Use about half of what you normally would for a load of laundry. Add the detergent when the machine is about halfway filled with water. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Add the shoes when the machine is about three-quarters filled with water.
steps.content: Add the shoes when the machine is about three-quarters filled with water. Let the cycle run its course and then take out the shoes when it's finished. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Let the shoes air dry.
steps.content: Let the shoes air dry. Do not place them in the dryer or over a vent. This will result in shrunken and distorted shoes. Place the shoes in a well ventilated area and let them air dry. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Enjoy your shoes.
steps.content: Enjoy your shoes. They should be as white as new!
